segment.source: Description: Here’s the info you need to create a Universal Windows app that can run on any Windows 10-based device, including phones, tablets, and PCs.
segment.target: Description: Here’s the info you need to create a Universal Windows app that can run on any Windows 10-based device, including phones, tablets, and PCs.

segment.source: title: How-to guides for Windows 10 apps - Windows app development
segment.target: title: How-to guides for Windows 10 apps - Windows app development

segment.source: How-to guides for Windows 10 apps
segment.target: How-to guides for Windows 10 apps

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Here’s the info you need to create a Universal Windows app that can run on any Windows 10-based device, including phones, tablets, and PCs.
segment.target: Here’s the info you need to create a Universal Windows app that can run on any Windows 10-based device, including phones, tablets, and PCs.

segment.source: This section offers both instructions and code examples organized by the kind of task you want to accomplish.
segment.target: This section offers both instructions and code examples organized by the kind of task you want to accomplish.

segment.source: If you'd like an introduction to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) and how it lets you use the same code to deliver appropriately tailored experiences to multiple Windows device types, see these articles:
segment.target: If you'd like an introduction to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) and how it lets you use the same code to deliver appropriately tailored experiences to multiple Windows device types, see these articles:

segment.source: Create your first Universal Windows app
segment.target: Create your first Universal Windows app

segment.source: Guide to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Guide to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: What's a Universal Windows app?
segment.target: What's a Universal Windows app?

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Accessibility
segment.target: Accessibility

segment.source: Create Universal Windows apps that are accessible to the widest possible range of device types and user audiences, including people who have impairments or disabilities.
segment.target: Create Universal Windows apps that are accessible to the widest possible range of device types and user audiences, including people who have impairments or disabilities.

segment.source: App data and settings
segment.target: App data and settings

segment.source: Find out how and where a Universal Windows app stores both app data and user data.
segment.target: Find out how and where a Universal Windows app stores both app data and user data.

segment.source: Learn from scenarios that describe the different storage options and the situations where each provides the best experience.
segment.target: Learn from scenarios that describe the different storage options and the situations where each provides the best experience.

segment.source: App-to-app communication
segment.target: App-to-app communication

segment.source: Learn how Universal Windows apps (including Windows web apps) can launch other apps and exchange data and files.
segment.target: Learn how Universal Windows apps (including Windows web apps) can launch other apps and exchange data and files.

segment.source: Complex tasks that would normally require a user to manage multiple apps can now be handled seamlessly.
segment.target: Complex tasks that would normally require a user to manage multiple apps can now be handled seamlessly.

segment.source: Audio, video, and camera
segment.target: Audio, video, and camera

segment.source: Capture photos and videos from a capture device, such as a webcam, and render audio streams in an app.
segment.target: Capture photos and videos from a capture device, such as a webcam, and render audio streams in an app.

segment.source: Contacts and calendar
segment.target: Contacts and calendar

segment.source: Let your users access their Windows contacts and calendar appointments from your app, so they can share content, email, and calendar info, or send messages without having to switch between Windows apps.
segment.target: Let your users access their Windows contacts and calendar appointments from your app, so they can share content, email, and calendar info, or send messages without having to switch between Windows apps.

segment.source: Controls, layouts, and text
segment.target: Controls, layouts, and text

segment.source: Learn about user interface components, like text, buttons, lists, and windows that are available and the various options and layouts available to support a fully-interactive user experience.
segment.target: Learn about user interface components, like text, buttons, lists, and windows that are available and the various options and layouts available to support a fully-interactive user experience.

segment.source: Custom user interactions
segment.target: Custom user interactions

segment.source: Find out about the user interaction platform, the input sources (including touch, touchpad, mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard), modes (touch keyboard, mouse wheel, pen eraser, and so on), and user interactions supported by Universal Windows apps.
segment.target: Find out about the user interaction platform, the input sources (including touch, touchpad, mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard), modes (touch keyboard, mouse wheel, pen eraser, and so on), and user interactions supported by Universal Windows apps.

segment.source: Data access
segment.target: Data access

segment.source: Learn about storing data on the device in a private database and using object relational mapping in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: Learn about storing data on the device in a private database and using object relational mapping in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: Data binding
segment.target: Data binding

segment.source: Synchronize the UI elements of your Universal Windows app with different sources of data, including databases, files, and internal objects, to provide a data-driven user experience.
segment.target: Synchronize the UI elements of your Universal Windows app with different sources of data, including databases, files, and internal objects, to provide a data-driven user experience.

segment.source: Debugging, testing, and performance
segment.target: Debugging, testing, and performance

segment.source: Learn about the testing and debugging cycle and how to use the related tools provided with Microsoft Visual Studio or as separate downloads.
segment.target: Learn about the testing and debugging cycle and how to use the related tools provided with Microsoft Visual Studio or as separate downloads.

segment.source: Make sure your Universal Windows app delivers the experience you intend and is ready for publication to the Windows Store.
segment.target: Make sure your Universal Windows app delivers the experience you intend and is ready for publication to the Windows Store.

segment.source: Devices, sensors, and power
segment.target: Devices, sensors, and power

segment.source: Integrate different devices like printers, cameras, and sensors into your Universal Windows app to provide a robust and flexible connected-device experience for your users.
segment.target: Integrate different devices like printers, cameras, and sensors into your Universal Windows app to provide a robust and flexible connected-device experience for your users.

segment.source: Enterprise
segment.target: Enterprise

segment.source: Learn about the key enterprise features for Windows 10 Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: Learn about the key enterprise features for Windows 10 Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: Files, folders, and libraries
segment.target: Files, folders, and libraries

segment.source: Learn how to read and write text and other data formats in files, and manage files and folders.
segment.target: Learn how to read and write text and other data formats in files, and manage files and folders.

segment.source: Also find info about reading and writing app settings, about file and folder pickers, and about special, "sandboxed" locations such as the Video/Music library.
segment.target: Also find info about reading and writing app settings, about file and folder pickers, and about special, "sandboxed" locations such as the Video/Music library.

segment.source: Games and DirectX
segment.target: Games and DirectX

segment.source: Understand the basics of creating games on the new Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
segment.target: Understand the basics of creating games on the new Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

segment.source: Globalization and localization
segment.target: Globalization and localization

segment.source: Adapt your Universal Windows app for additional languages, markets, cultures, and regions.
segment.target: Adapt your Universal Windows app for additional languages, markets, cultures, and regions.

segment.source: This info guides you through a set of best practices for development, and points you to more details about how to prepare your app for international markets.
segment.target: This info guides you through a set of best practices for development, and points you to more details about how to prepare your app for international markets.

segment.source: Graphics and animation
segment.target: Graphics and animation

segment.source: Enhance your Universal Windows app with UI graphics and animations that keep users visually engaged and interested in the user experience.
segment.target: Enhance your Universal Windows app with UI graphics and animations that keep users visually engaged and interested in the user experience.

segment.source: Launching, resuming, and background tasks
segment.target: Launching, resuming, and background tasks

segment.source: Create background tasks and register for system-generated events to provide functionality even when your Universal Windows app is suspended or not running.
segment.target: Create background tasks and register for system-generated events to provide functionality even when your Universal Windows app is suspended or not running.

segment.source: Maps and location
segment.target: Maps and location

segment.source: Learn how your Universal Windows app can tap into the Bing Maps service and produce accurate map visuals that now include aerial 3D imagery and street-level views.
segment.target: Learn how your Universal Windows app can tap into the Bing Maps service and produce accurate map visuals that now include aerial 3D imagery and street-level views.

segment.source: Monetize your app
segment.target: Monetize your app

segment.source: Create free apps, trials (both time-based and feature-based), paid apps, and in-app products, to give your customers the option to try your app for free and make purchase decisions during their experience with your app.
segment.target: Create free apps, trials (both time-based and feature-based), paid apps, and in-app products, to give your customers the option to try your app for free and make purchase decisions during their experience with your app.

segment.source: Navigation
segment.target: Navigation

segment.source: Learn about the various options you have to support navigation between pages and content in your app.
segment.target: Learn about the various options you have to support navigation between pages and content in your app.

segment.source: Networking and web services
segment.target: Networking and web services

segment.source: Create a connected, or network-aware, Universal Windows app that can use available network connections to do things like fetch RSS feeds, engage in multiplayer games, or interact with nearby devices.
segment.target: Create a connected, or network-aware, Universal Windows app that can use available network connections to do things like fetch RSS feeds, engage in multiplayer games, or interact with nearby devices.

segment.source: Packaging apps
segment.target: Packaging apps

segment.source: Understand the app package that contains the files that constitute your Universal Windows app, and how you work with it to deploy, manage, and update your app through the Windows Store.
segment.target: Understand the app package that contains the files that constitute your Universal Windows app, and how you work with it to deploy, manage, and update your app through the Windows Store.

segment.source: Also learn about app capabilities, which must be declared in the app package manifest for access to specific resources.
segment.target: Also learn about app capabilities, which must be declared in the app package manifest for access to specific resources.

segment.source: Porting apps to Windows 10
segment.target: Porting apps to Windows 10

segment.source: Bring an existing app to the UWP where you can create a single app package that not only targets the Windows-based devices of your choosing, but also capitalizes on features and user experiences unique to each device type.
segment.target: Bring an existing app to the UWP where you can create a single app package that not only targets the Windows-based devices of your choosing, but also capitalizes on features and user experiences unique to each device type.

segment.source: Security
segment.target: Security

segment.source: Manage sensitive user info and help secure app data and resources while keeping the user experience intact.
segment.target: Manage sensitive user info and help secure app data and resources while keeping the user experience intact.

segment.source: Features like basic password protection, roaming credentials, single sign-on, Microsoft account authentication, and cryptography are all at your disposal.
segment.target: Features like basic password protection, roaming credentials, single sign-on, Microsoft account authentication, and cryptography are all at your disposal.

segment.source: Threading and async programming
segment.target: Threading and async programming

segment.source: Use asynchronous programming to help your app stay responsive by allowing it to continue to run and respond to the UI while it completes other work that might take an extended amount of time.
segment.target: Use asynchronous programming to help your app stay responsive by allowing it to continue to run and respond to the UI while it completes other work that might take an extended amount of time.

segment.source: Tiles, badges, and notifications
segment.target: Tiles, badges, and notifications

segment.source: Design tiles (including secondary tiles and lock-screen apps), badges, and toast notifications that your Universal Windows app can use to communicate new, real-time info to users in the form of text, images, or both.
segment.target: Design tiles (including secondary tiles and lock-screen apps), badges, and toast notifications that your Universal Windows app can use to communicate new, real-time info to users in the form of text, images, or both.

segment.source: Windows Runtime components
segment.target: Windows Runtime components

segment.source: Learn more about these self-contained objects that you can initialize and use from any language, including C#, Visual Basic, JavaScript, and C++.
segment.target: Learn more about these self-contained objects that you can initialize and use from any language, including C#, Visual Basic, JavaScript, and C++.

segment.source: For example, you could create a Windows Runtime component in C++ that uses a third-party library to perform a computationally expensive operation, or simply reuse some Visual Basic or C# code in your Universal Windows app.
segment.target: For example, you could create a Windows Runtime component in C++ that uses a third-party library to perform a computationally expensive operation, or simply reuse some Visual Basic or C# code in your Universal Windows app.

segment.source: XAML platform
segment.target: XAML platform

segment.source: Get started with the basic concepts of the XAML programming language.
segment.target: Get started with the basic concepts of the XAML programming language.

segment.source: Or, if you're already familiar with XAML, jump ahead and learn how to implement Windows Runtime features in XAML using Visual Studio to create a great Universal Windows app.
segment.target: Or, if you're already familiar with XAML, jump ahead and learn how to implement Windows Runtime features in XAML using Visual Studio to create a great Universal Windows app.
